title: So.... what exactly is the difference between Suppression and Stun?

replies.body:
Suppression cant be lowered by tenacity. Suppression cant be {{summoner:1}}'d. Supression cant be removed with {{item:3222}}

Edit: Forgot another,  you cant use any summoners what-so-ever while suppressed
Suppression can't be Mikaels'd? Are you sure?

Yes, it doesn't work.

QSS is the only item that can remove it.
100% sure.

What's an example of a champion that has a 'snare'?

Browsing through the wiki description of most champs that come to mind, all of them seem pretty consistently described by 'root' and it's not clear to me that a cc type called 'snare' actually exists in league.
you know what, now that you mention it, i cant specifically think of one, i swear i remember being annoyed by seeing the word snare, if i find one ill give it to you, if i was wrong it was my bad
Ryze has a snare. Lux has a snare. Morgana has a snare.

Also, there is no difference. It is all about what is being used. Example: Lux's Q is called a snare because it is a sort of cage. Zyra's E is a manifestation of plants, so it makes more sense that it would be called a root. Basically, if it surrounds you like a cage, it is a snare, and if it grips you like vines, it is a root. Logically, this applies to all forms of snares and roots, not just vines and cages.

Suppressions also need to be Channeled and during that time Champions cannot move or the CC is broken. after the Stun a champion is free to do as he pleases. (Urgot is a special case because his is an execution as well as a surpression)

Suppressions are harder to cleanse, and they typically involve the champion actively 'holding down' the target.

Champions suppressing typically can't take many other actions. Urgot and Skarner can move, and that's about it.

Renekton's W would be a Suppress, technically, if he couldn't cancel out of it, for example.
i remember pre rework ww, im unsure if it was a glitch or not but i could qss his ult, i would still get hurt but i could walk around and stuff

WW's old ult was technically a targeted DoT effect.
Not a bug, just a tech limitation at the time.
Urgod's R2 doesn't actually suppress victims; it applies stasis.
You forgot {{champion:2}}
Suppression blocks the use of ALL summoner spells, whereas stuns only block flash and teleport
The main thing I'm aware of is that you can't cleanse (summoner spell) a suppression. I don't think you can use any summoner spells during suppression.
Suppressions don't get reduced by tenacity. Suppressions prevent summoner spell usage.
